
### Numbers ðŸ˜”

![numbers-pensive](https://github.com/Hed6eH0g/ctf/blob/main/2023/tamuctf/numbers-pensive/numbers_0.png)

In this challenge, since an arbitrary pair of `e` and `d` except for `e=65537` is available, we can compute `phi` and `d = 65537^-1 mod phi`.
It immediately allows us to recover the flag as follows.

```
#!/usr/bin/env python3

from Crypto.Util.number import long_to_bytes, bytes_to_long

n = 
e = 5
d = 
phi = e*d - 1

import libnum
e = 65537
d = pow(e, -1, phi)
c = 
m = pow(c, d, n)
print(m)

print('check:')
print(pow(m, e, n) == c)
```
